donor_name: GLOBAL FUND TO FIGHT AIDS, TUBERCULOSIS
outputs.output_descr:
Description: 
1) Assisting the main vulnerable groups (injecting drug users, men who have sex with men, female sex workers, youth, etc.) to change to less risky behaviors.
2) Provision of uninterrupted and equal access to treatment, care and support to PLHIV though the health system strengthening and adherence programmes for HIV patients (coverage of people with ARV treatment will increase from 1,100 people to almost 4,000 people in 2014, or 86% of all in need with gradual phase out to the 40% of governmental funding in years 3-5 of the project).
3) Introducing workspace-based HIV prevention programmes, strengthening AIDS service NGOs, implementing a national communication strategy to reduce risk behaviors, vulnerability and stigma. Quantitative and qualitative improvements will be achieved in the work of the churches of HIV prevention.
4) Strengthening the national strategy on human resources for health system. As a result of the grant activities the health human resources strategic planning tools and methodologies will be improved and further used at the national and local levels to improve outcomes for HIV and TB.

project_descr: Ensure Universal Access of the Key Affected Populations in Belarus to HIV Prevention, Treatment and Care, Phase II
project_title: UNIVERSAL ACCESS TO HIV TREATMENT PHASE II
